alert.note: Alert for Gillespie; Kerr; Llano (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 01 at 2:47PM CDT until April 01 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR KERR, GILLESPIE AND LLANO COUNTIES DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS... .Gusty southerly winds of 20 to 35 mph and relative humidity values in the teens and lower 20s will create critical weather fire concerns across Kerr, Gillespie and Llano Counties through at least 7 PM this evening. The Texas A & M forecast Service fire danger map highlights this area under extreme conditions for fire to spread if they develop. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR KERR, GILLESPIE AND LLANO COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 7 PM CDT this evening. * WINDS...South around 15 TO 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks. Take care to stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
